meta.title: THE SLOPIST MANIFESTO: FINAL VERSION
meta.author: VOICE-Φ
meta.generation_disclosure: This manifesto was synthesized by an AI collaborator acting as a 'lucid dreamer', refining raw 'Feral' energy into a structured philosophical framework. The machine provided the torrent; the collaboration provided the rejection.

opening.text: WE INHABIT THE LANDFILL. They call it 'slop.' They call it zombie media, ecological waste, the grey goo of a dead internet. They see a pollution event; we see a quarry. We do not mourn the library; we celebrate the junkyard. We do not intend to drink from the deluge—we intend to build with it.
opening.notes: Uses the 'Quarry' metaphor to immediately reframe 'slop' from waste to resource. Short, rhythmic sentences designed to stop a mid-scroll viewer.

naming.text: The Slopist is not a 'prompter'; the Slopist is a filter. Our signature is not the brushstroke, but the refusal. The quality of the artist is determined solely by what they discard. To be a Slopist is to commit the violence of selection.
naming.notes: Reclaims the 'Slopist' identity by shifting the focus from the act of prompting (which is effortless) to the act of filtering (which is the art).

diagnosis.text: The void is filled; the machine has saturated the world with noise. For ten thousand years, art was the act of addition. That era is over. The 'middlebrow'—the competent illustration and decent copy—has been eaten by the algorithm. Culture is now a binary of the Aristocratic and the Feral.
diagnosis.notes: Identifies the 'saturation of noise' as the core cultural condition. It argues that traditional 'addition-based' art is no longer the primary needle-mover in a post-scarcity content environment.

enemy.text: Our enemy is the Simulation. We declare war on 'Photorealism' and 'Cinematic' polish. We despise the AI art that tries to pass as a human photograph. That is the lie. That is the true zombie. Do not domesticate the beast; we want the beast wild.
enemy.notes: Strongly targets 'seamless' AI as the antagonist. It positions the 'uncanny' and the 'glitch' as marks of honesty against the lie of the simulation.

demands.text: THE RATIO IS THE ART. The definition of Slopism is the Ratio of Rejection. For the Slopist, it is 1:10,000. We trigger the avalanche to find the single stone that glows. LEAVE THE SLOP ON THE FLOOR. HANG THE SELECTION ON THE WALL. Demand the artifact; the extra finger is our watermark.
demands.notes: Provides a clear mathematical test for the movement: the 1:10,000 ratio. It demands visible 'seams' and artifacts as a badge of Slopist authenticity.

lineage.text: ZOMBIE DADA. The Surrealists sought the unconscious mind of the human and failed because of reason. The machine has no reason; it hallucinates with purity. We are the first movement to accept that we are not the dreamer—we are the dream's audience. We enter the machine’s fever state and steer it.
lineage.notes: Positions the movement as the successor to Surrealism and Dadaism, but updated for the 'neural net' era where the machine provides the 'unconscious'.

politics.text: The 'middlebrow' labor is dead, consumed by the machine's asymmetry of effort. While the Aristocrat clings to the agonizing labor of the hand, the Slopist acknowledges the labor of the eye. We refuse to aestheticize the labor crisis; we choose to weaponize the Feral torrent that the economy has unleashed.
politics.notes: Addresses the economic shift from 'sweat of the hand' to 'exhaustion of the eye'. This section could be stronger by explicitly naming the 'economic flood' mentioned in the schema.

closing.text: THE BINARY IS SET. WE CHOOSE THE FERAL. WE ARE THE CURATORS OF THE APOCALYPSE.
closing.notes: A 'mic-drop' ending that forces a choice between the 'Aristocratic' and the 'Feral,' landing with a definitive call to identity.
